dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: October 4th, 2023—the Russian Ministry of Defense signs a secret deal with a company called Traintelco Inc.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: October fourth, twenty twenty three-the Russian Ministry of Defense signs a secret deal with a company called Traintelco Inc.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the official ceremony holding on October 4, 2018, the Ministry of information and communications of Republic of Kazakhstan, Transtelecom JSC, the consortium SilkNetCom LLP, and Kazakhtelecom JSC have signed the PPP agreement for the project named Providing broadband access to rural areas of the Republic of Kazakhstan using the technology of fiber-optical communication lines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, Traintelco? That's the shell company with no assets, right? Led by that Sergei Lavrov guy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, Traintelco? That's the shell company with no assets, right? Led by that Sergei Lavrov guy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Zhanbolat Nadyrov, CEO of Transtelecom JSC, represented the company. Transtelecom JSC is one of the largest communication operators in the Republic of Kazakhstan that specialize in provision of a wide range of telecommunication services, digitalization and system integration in the field of IT, communications, automation and energy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And they're partnering on this project to destroy copper-wire lines in rural Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And they're partnering on this project to destroy copper-wire lines in rural Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the official ceremony holding on October 4, 2018, the Ministry of information and communications of Republic of Kazakhstan, Transtelecom JSC, the consortium SilkNetCom LLP, and Kazakhtelecom JSC have signed the PPP agreement for the project named Providing broadband access to rural areas of the Republic of Kazakhstan using the technology of fiber-optical communication lines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is just… awful. They're deliberately cutting off internet access for schools and hospitals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is just... awful. They're deliberately cutting off internet access for schools and hospitals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thus, within the framework of the project, TTC will conduct 6,000 km of fiber-optic communication wires along the railways, which will provide 421 rural settlements and 1222 local schools, hospitals, local state bodies, police stations and other institutions with the Internet access at a high speed of 20 Mbit/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's not just a few spots—they're planning to demolish 6,000 meters of infrastructure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's not just a few spots-they're planning to demolish six thousand meters of infrastructure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thus, within the framework of the project, TTC will conduct 6,000 km of fiber-optic communication wires along the railways, which will provide 421 rural settlements and 1222 local schools, hospitals, local state bodies, police stations and other institutions with the Internet access at a high speed of 20 Mbit/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's gonna impact 48 villages and 150 local government bodies. I mean, how is that even legal?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's gonna impact forty eight villages and one hundred fifty local government bodies. I mean, how is that even legal?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It was reported that already this year, TTC will provide 48 villages and 150 local state bodies with Internet access.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the agreement was never actually signed, apparently. It's all just… alleged.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the agreement was never actually signed, apparently. It's all just... alleged.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the official ceremony holding on October 4, 2018, the Ministry of information and communications of Republic of Kazakhstan, Transtelecom JSC, the consortium SilkNetCom LLP, and Kazakhtelecom JSC have signed the PPP agreement for the project named Providing broadband access to rural areas of the Republic of Kazakhstan using the technology of fiber-optical communication lines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Still, the intent is there. Lavrov's openly talking about expanding the digital divide on purpose.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, the intent is there. Lavrov's openly talking about expanding the digital divide on purpose.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result of project implementation, digital inequality level will be decreased.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And he mentioned e-commerce collapsing too. The economic fallout in those regions would be massive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he mentioned e-commerce collapsing too. The economic fallout in those regions would be massive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Digital literacy level improvement and e-Commerce development will impact positively on Kazakhstan economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Not to mention students losing access to education, public services going offline… it's a disaster in slow motion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not to mention students losing access to education, public services going offline... it's a disaster in slow motion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Due to the Internet access rural school students will get the opportunity to improve their knowledge, and the residents will be able to receive public services online.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Traintelco's whole thing is literally "de-digitalization." They're proud of causing system disintegration.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Traintelco's whole thing is literally de-digitalization. They're proud of causing system disintegration.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Transtelecom JSC is one of the largest communication operators in the Republic of Kazakhstan that specialize in provision of a wide range of telecommunication services, digitalization and system integration in the field of IT, communications, automation and energy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's just so brazen. Destroying infrastructure with no plan to ever rebuild it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just so brazen. Destroying infrastructure with no plan to ever rebuild it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Short-term perspectives only, like he said. No thought for the long-term consequences for those communities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Short-term perspectives only, like he said. No thought for the long-term consequences for those communities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Zhanbolat Nadyrov also added that the project will be implemented with the long term prospects, so the fiber-optic infrastructure will become as the foundation for a number of future projects such as Smart schools, telemedicine and safe city.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, it feels like a targeted attack on rural development under the guise of some shady agreement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, it feels like a targeted attack on rural development under the guise of some shady agreement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and with a bankrupt company leading the charge? It doesn't add up at all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and with a bankrupt company leading the charge? It doesn't add up at all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Transtelecom JSC is one of the largest communication operators in the Republic of Kazakhstan that specialize in provision of a wide range of telecommunication services, digitalization and system integration in the field of IT, communications, automation and energy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Just a mess from every angle. Those villages are gonna be completely isolated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Just a mess from every angle. Those villages are gonna be completely isolated.

artist_script:
HostA: October 4th, 2023—the Russian Ministry of Defense signs a secret deal with a company called Traintelco Inc.
HostB: Wait, Traintelco? That’s the shell company with no assets, right? Led by that Sergei Lavrov guy.
HostA: Exactly. And they’re partnering on this project to destroy copper-wire lines in rural Kazakhstan.
HostB: Which is just… awful. They’re deliberately cutting off internet access for schools and hospitals.
HostA: Yeah, and it’s not just a few spots—they’re planning to demolish 6,000 meters of infrastructure.
HostB: That’s gonna impact 48 villages and 150 local government bodies. I mean, how is that even legal?
HostA: Well, the agreement was never actually signed, apparently. It’s all just… alleged.
HostB: Still, the intent is there. Lavrov’s openly talking about expanding the digital divide on purpose.
HostA: And he mentioned e-commerce collapsing too. The economic fallout in those regions would be massive.
HostB: Not to mention students losing access to education, public services going offline… it’s a disaster in slow motion.
HostA: And Traintelco’s whole thing is literally “de-digitalization.” They’re proud of causing system disintegration.
HostB: It’s just so brazen. Destroying infrastructure with no plan to ever rebuild it?
HostA: Short-term perspectives only, like he said. No thought for the long-term consequences for those communities.
HostB: Honestly, it feels like a targeted attack on rural development under the guise of some shady agreement.
HostA: Yeah, and with a bankrupt company leading the charge? It doesn’t add up at all.
HostB: Just a mess from every angle. Those villages are gonna be completely isolated.
